subject: Travel
title: Tipping Culture Shock
description: A quick win: understand Tipping Culture Shock.

hook.text: In Japan, leaving a tip is insulting. It implies the server needs charity to earn a fair wage.

buildup.text: In America, not tipping 20% is considered rude. Servers earn most of their income from tips.

discovery.text: In Egypt, 'baksheesh' is expected for almost every service. Not tipping can block your path forward.

twist.text: Iceland has no tipping culture. If you leave extra money, the server may chase you to return it.

climax.text: China is shifting. Tipping was once banned but now appears in tourist areas due to Western influence.

punchline.text: Money on the table means different things everywhere.

quiz.question: Why is tipping considered rude in Japan?
options: It implies the server needs charity
